get.description: Gets the chat settings for the broadcaster's chat room.

parameters.name: moderator_id
parameters.description: Optional moderator ID for additional fields (requires moderator:read:chat_settings scope)

emote_mode.description: Set to true if only emotes are allowed

follower_mode.description: Set to true if only followers may chat

slow_mode_wait_time.description: Time in seconds chatters must wait between sending messages (3 through 120 seconds). If set, SlowMode must be true.

unique_chat_mode.description: Set to true if users may only post unique messages in chat

get.description: Gets the color used for the user's name in chat.

parameters.description: Chat color (Hex code for Prime/Turbo users, or default color name)

post.description: Sends a chat message to the broadcaster's chat room. The message is limited to a maximum of 500 characters.

get.description: Gets information about specified clips. If multiple IDs are specified, returns them in the order they are provided.

parameters.name: game_id
parameters.description: ID of the game. Mutually exclusive with broadcaster_id and id

parameters.name: first

parameters.description: If false, clip is captured from the live stream when the API is called; if true, clip is captured after the delay

get.description: Gets a list of entitlements for a specified ID or that belong to a specified user or game. Entitlements are digital items that users are entitled to use. Twitch entitlements are granted based on viewership engagement with a content creator, based on the game developers' campaign.

parameters.description: A user ID used to filter the list

parameters.name: first
parameters.description: Maximum number of items to return

parameters.description: ID of the user whose entitlement codes you want to check

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: Entitlement codes to check. Limit 20 codes
